1.post_text:
You danced, took pictures, and showed your love for dad with us! 

Our Soccer Buddies will again be on the move this weekend to lookout for customers game enough to get in on all the 2014 FIFA World Cup fun!
- Treat yourself and a friend to our Copa-Banana Pies for lunch, and take a wacky picture with our Soccer Buddies during dinner time on Friday
- Be Spotted with our 10pc Samba Spicy Drumlets during lunch, and do a dance with our Soccer Buddies in the evening on Saturday
- Share a FIFA World Cup Share Box with your friends for lunch, and shout “McDonald’s FIFA World Cup” in the evening on Sunday

And if you want a taste of Brazil, we’ll be hosting another afternoon of Samba Celebrations this Saturday at our weekend carnival. Expect drum and samba performances, football juggling and table soccer fun. 

Don’t forget to share your World Cup selfies with us too!

7.post_text: Our very first McDonald’s Football Clinic has concluded. Each and every young football lover who attended did tremendously well, and we’d like to congratulate Soon Jan Tze, Abdul Rasyid and Dhamiri Zahid Imran for each winning a one year’s scholarship to the ESPZEN Soccer School & Academy! Well done!

14.post_text:
The highly anticipated sporting event begins just hours away! If you’re catching the opening match tonight, we’ll be screening the match live at 38 of our 24-hour restaurants. To find out if your nearest restaurant is screening the match, visit http://fifaworldcup.mcdonalds.com.sg/events.php.

And for those catching the match at home, remember to use your Citibank Visa Credit Card to place your McDelivery orders online or via the McDelivery app for a daily* chance to win $1000 in cash! This promotion is applicable for orders of at least $20 on food and drink in a single receipt, and is valid from 5 June to 16 July. 

*Winners will be drawn on a weekly basis

15.post_text:
Our Soccer Buddies are on their move around our restaurants to spot and reward you this World Cup season! Here’s your chance to join in the football fun and grab some prizes:
- Get spotted with our new Brazilian-inspired burgers during lunch and do a dance with our Soccer Buddies at dinnertime tomorrow
- Get spotted enjoying our World Cup Special for lunch and take a photo with our Soccer Buddies during dinner this Saturday 
- Get spotted sharing Copa-Banana Pie with your Dad for lunch and declare your love for him at dinnertime on Father’s Day this Sunday

Don’t forget our second Samba Celebration Carnival this weekend and come show us your football juggling and penalty shoot out skills too! See you there ;)

BRING BACK SAMURAI PLEASE.

Brazilians Don't Support The World Cup, And You Shouldn't Either!!!
1) The $11,000,000,000 spent on the event is desperately needed for healthcare, education and public housing.
2) Many Brazilian people can't afford to live in their own homes.
3) It's increasing the demand in the child sex trafficking industry... and the cops don't seem to care.
4) Thousands of Brazilians who had homes have been forced out of their homes for the construction of stadiums.
5) Indigenous Brazilian people are experiencing reservation reductions.
6) Police brutality is rampant.
7) Citizens' basic human rights are being infringed upon.
Source: http://news.distractify.com/people/52-of-brazilians-dont-support-the-world-cup-and-here-are-7-reasons-why-you-shouldnt-either/
